txt.en: 'Curse my foolish pride! I should never have ventured into this worm-lair on my own. There are just too many of them, and now that I have found this safe place, I do not dare try to sneak away on my own. \n\n'Can you help me to escape? I would ask that you not tell the other hunters, for I would be ridiculed for the rest of my life.'

'Machan is safe then, is he? Good. He is an impulsive and proud man, and I had feared that he might have gotten in over his own head.

'Not that such a thing could ever happen, nor would his pride permit him to be rescued if it did.'

'I suspect that I -- and Machan -- owe you greater thanks than your tale suggests, and so I do thank you most sincerely.'
Machan foolishly sought to hunt fire-worms alone and ended up trapped and wounded.
Talk to Machan when you are ready
Help Machan to get out of the fire-worm lair.
Escort Machan out of the worm-lair
Tell Murdaig√°n that Machan is safe.
